14195.name: Comprehend texts
14195.text:
use behaviours that are not intentionally directed at another person to:

attend to, respond to or show interest in familiar people, texts, events and activities

14198.name: Comprehend texts
14198.text:
use informal behaviours that show consistent anticipation of events in regular routines to:

attend consistently to familiar texts
respond consistently to social interactions with familiar people
demonstrate anticipation of predictable events
respond to questions
respond to requests

14217.name: Navigate read and view learning area texts
14217.text: navigate, read and view texts with illustrations and simple graphics

14227.name: Listen and respond to learning area texts
14227.text: listen to two or more step instructions for undertaking learning tasks, listen for information about topics being learned in spoken and audio texts, including audio-visual texts, and respond to texts read aloud

14222.name: Interpret and analyse learning area texts
14222.text: interpret and use texts to explore topics, gather information and make some obvious inferences using comprehension strategies

14232.name: Navigate read and view learning area texts
14232.text: navigate, read and view different types of texts with illustrations and more detailed graphics

14236.name: Listen and respond to learning area texts
14236.text: listen to spoken instructions with some detail for undertaking learning area tasks, listen to identify key information in spoken and audio texts, including audio-visual texts, and respond to texts read aloud

14239.name: Interpret and analyse learning area texts
14239.text: interpret literal information and make inferences to expand topic knowledge using comprehension strategies

14256.name: Navigate read and view learning area texts
14256.text: navigate, read and view subject-specific texts with some challenging features and a range of graphic representations

14252.name: Listen and respond to learning area texts
14252.text: listen to detailed spoken instructions for undertaking learning tasks, listen to spoken and audio texts, including audio-visual texts, and respond to and interpret information and opinions presented

14253.name: Interpret and analyse learning area texts
14253.text: interpret and analyse information and ideas, comparing texts on similar topics or themes using comprehension strategies

14264.name: Navigate read and view learning area texts
14264.text: navigate, read and view a variety of challenging subject-specific texts with a wide range of graphic representations

14260.name: Listen and respond to learning area texts
14260.text: listen to extended spoken and audio texts, including audio-visual texts, respond to and interpret stated and implied meanings, and evaluate information and ideas

14272.name: Interpret and analyse learning area texts
14272.text: interpret and evaluate information, identify main ideas and supporting evidence, and analyse different perspectives using comprehension strategies

14275.name: Navigate read and view learning area texts
14275.text: navigate, read and view a wide range of more demanding subject-specific texts with an extensive range of graphic representations

14281.name: Listen and respond to learning area texts
14281.text: listen to a range of extended spoken and audio texts, including audio-visual texts, and respond to, interpret and evaluate ideas, information and opinions

14283.name: Interpret and analyse learning area texts
14283.text: interpret and evaluate information within and between texts, comparing and contrasting information using comprehension strategies

14196.name: Compose texts
14196.text:
use behaviours that are not intentionally directed at another person to:

refuse or reject
reflect a preference or desire
reflect state of wellbeing, for example contentment, joy, worry, pain
reflect a physical state, for example hot, cold, nausea

14197.name: Compose texts
14197.text:
use informal behaviours to intentionally communicate a single message consistently in familiar environments with familiar people, such as to:

refuse or reject
express a preference
request the continuation of an activity
request something new
request more
request attention

14230.name: Compose spoken written visual and multimodal learning area texts
14230.text: compose and edit a small range of learning area texts

14223.name: Use language to interact with others
14223.text: use pair, group and class discussions as learning tools to explore learning area topics, to represent ideas and relationships, and to prepare for creating texts

14219.name: Deliver presentations
14219.text: plan, rehearse and deliver short presentations on learning area topics, incorporating some visual and multimodal elements

14231.name: Compose spoken written visual and multimodal learning area texts
14231.text: compose and edit a range of learning area texts

14240.name: Use language to interact with others
14240.text: use pair, group and class discussions about learning area topics as learning tools to explore and represent ideas and relationships, test possibilities and to prepare for creating texts

14233.name: Deliver presentations
14233.text: plan, rehearse and deliver presentations on learning area topics, incorporating some learned content and appropriate visual and multimodal elements

14247.name: Compose spoken written visual and multimodal learning area texts
14247.text: compose and edit learning area texts

14251.name: Use language to interact with others
14251.text: use pair, group and class discussions and informal debates as learning tools to explore ideas and relationships, test possibilities, compare solutions and to prepare for creating texts

14255.name: Deliver presentations
14255.text: plan, research, rehearse and deliver presentations on learning area topics, selecting appropriate content and visual and multimodal elements to suit different audiences

14259.name: Compose spoken written visual and multimodal learning area texts
14259.text: compose and edit longer sustained learning area texts

14266.name: Use language to interact with others
14266.text: use pair, group and class discussions and formal and informal debates as learning tools to explore ideas, test possibilities, compare solutions, rehearse ideas and arguments in preparation for creating texts

14265.name: Deliver presentations
14265.text: plan, research, rehearse and deliver presentations on learning area topics, sequencing selected content and multimodal elements for accuracy and their impact on the audience

14284.name: Compose spoken written visual and multimodal learning area texts
14284.text: compose and edit longer and more complex learning area texts

14286.name: Use language to interact with others
14286.text: use pair, group and class discussions and formal and informal debates as learning tools to explore ideas, compare solutions, evaluate information and ideas, refine opinions and arguments in preparation for creating texts

14277.name: Deliver presentations
14277.text: plan, research, rehearse and deliver presentations on more complex issues and learning area topics, combining visual and multimodal elements creatively to present ideas and information and support opinions and engage and persuade an audience

14221.name: Use knowledge of text cohesion
14221.text: use knowledge of how texts are made cohesive through word repetitions and associations, synonyms and antonyms to comprehend and compose texts

14226.name: Use knowledge of text structures
14226.text: use knowledge of the structure and features of learning area texts to comprehend and compose a growing range of texts with some teacher support

14238.name: Use knowledge of text cohesion
14238.text: use knowledge of how texts are made cohesive through linking words and phrases, for example ‘so’, ‘therefore’, ‘then’, ‘in addition’, and the correct use of pronouns to comprehend and compose texts

14235.name: Use knowledge of text structures
14235.text: use growing knowledge of the structure and features of learning area texts to comprehend and compose an increasing number and range of texts

14258.name: Use knowledge of text cohesion
14258.text: use knowledge of how cohesive links can be made in texts through omitting and replacing words

14254.name: Use knowledge of text structures
14254.text: use developing knowledge of the structure and features of learning area texts to comprehend and compose a range of more complex texts for identified purposes

14269.name: Use knowledge of text cohesion
14269.text: use knowledge of word functions to make connections in texts

14268.name: Use knowledge of text structures
14268.text: use wide knowledge of the structure and features of learning area texts to comprehend and compose texts, using creative adaptations of text structures and conventions for citing others

14282.name: Use knowledge of text cohesion
14282.text: use knowledge of how the cohesion in texts is improved by strengthening the internal structure

14276.name: Use knowledge of text structures
14276.text: use comprehensive knowledge of the structure and features of learning area texts to comprehend and compose complex texts in innovative ways, using conventions for citing others

14218.name: Express opinion and point of view
14218.text: identify and use language that expresses feelings and opinions, and compares and evaluates people and things

14225.name: Use knowledge of sentence structures
14225.text: use simple and compound sentences to record observations, and make connections between ideas

14220.name: Use knowledge of words and word groups
14220.text: recognise and use nouns that represent people, places, things and ideas in the learning area and expand nouns to achieve greater precision

14234.name: Express opinion and point of view
14234.text: differentiate between the language of opinion and feeling and the language of factual reporting or recording

14237.name: Use knowledge of sentence structures
14237.text: use simple, compound and complex sentence structures to describe, explain, report and make connections between ideas and events

14242.name: Use knowledge of words and word groups
14242.text: recognise and use adverbs and prepositional phrases that provide detailed descriptions in the learning areas

14250.name: Express opinion and point of view
14250.text: use subjective, objective and evaluative language, and identify bias

14248.name: Use knowledge of sentence structures
14248.text: use simple, compound and complex sentence structures to record, explain, question, describe and elaborate ideas and events

14245.name: Use knowledge of words and word groups
14245.text: expand and sharpen ideas through careful choice of verbs and phrases and elaborated tenses

14271.name: Express opinion and point of view
14271.text: use language to evaluate an object, action or text, and language that is designed to persuade the reader/viewer

14261.name: Use knowledge of sentence structures
14261.text: control a range of simple, compound and complex sentence structures to record, explain, question, argue, describe and link ideas, evidence and conclusions

14270.name: Use knowledge of words and word groups
14270.text: recognise and use aspects of language to suggest possibility, probability, obligation and conditionality

14285.name: Express opinion and point of view
14285.text: use language that indirectly expresses opinions and constructs representations of people and events, and consider expressed and implied judgements

14278.name: Use knowledge of sentence structures
14278.text: control a range of simple, compound and complex sentence structures to convey complex ideas, build and support arguments, and change emphasis

14274.name: Use knowledge of words and word groups
14274.text: develop higher order concepts in academic texts through language features that compact and generalise ideas

14224.name: Use spelling knowledge
14224.text: spell topic words, new words with regular letter patterns and some common irregular words, and recognise meaning relationships between words such as ‘’play’, ‘playing’, ‘playground’

14229.name: Understand learning area vocabulary
14229.text: use mostly familiar vocabulary, with a steady introduction of new vocabulary in learning area contexts

14241.name: Use spelling knowledge
14241.text: spell topic words, more complex irregular words, regular words and word families containing known letters and letter clusters, and use strategies for attempting unknown words

14243.name: Understand learning area vocabulary
14243.text: use growing subject-specific vocabulary to read, discuss and write about learning area topics

14257.name: Use spelling knowledge
14257.text: spell topic words and use word origins, base words, prefixes and suffixes when spelling new words

14246.name: Understand learning area vocabulary
14246.text: use vocabulary, including subject-specific vocabulary from a range of learning areas and vocabulary that expresses shades of meaning

14263.name: Use spelling knowledge
14263.text: spell specialist topic words and use knowledge of word origins, base words, prefixes and suffixes and unusual letter combinations to spell correctly

14267.name: Understand learning area vocabulary
14267.text: use a wide range of new specialist and topic vocabulary to contribute to the specificity, authority and abstraction of texts

14280.name: Use spelling knowledge
14280.text: use knowledge of a wide range of English spelling conventions to spell unusual and technical words correctly and to deduce the meanings of unfamiliar words and spell unknown words

14279.name: Understand learning area vocabulary
14279.text: use subject-specific vocabulary to express abstract concepts, and refine vocabulary choices to discriminate between shades of meaning

14228.name: Understand how visual elements create meaning
14228.text: describe how images add to, contradict or multiply the meanings of words in a text, and compare images with the accompanying print text

14244.name: Understand how visual elements create meaning
14244.text: identify the effects of choices in the construction of images, including framing and composition

14249.name: Understand how visual elements create meaning
14249.text: explain how analytical images such as figures, diagrams, tables, maps and graphs contribute to understanding of factual information in texts

14262.name: Understand how visual elements create meaning
14262.text: analyse the effects of different visual elements upon the reader/viewer, and how visual texts such as advertisements and informative texts draw on and allude to other texts to enhance meaning

14273.name: Understand how visual elements create meaning
14273.text: evaluate the impact of different visual choices in the composition of images, including symbolic images and movement of camera or light, to achieve different nuances
